body:
This is because your resolver didn't return an error when the new input is getting registered.

![Screen Shot 2020-07-04 at 6 43 29 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10513364/86508802-42626200-be26-11ea-90de-fcd73436e1bb.png)

@bluebill1049 
when registering a new input, the resolver is passed the defaultValues `{ includeUserName: false, initialStateData: true }` instead of the current values `{ includeUserName: true }`. so in this case, the resolver will not return any errors since the defaultValues are valid

> @bluebill1049
> when registering a new input, the resolver is passed the defaultValues `{ includeUserName: false, initialStateData: true }` instead of the current values `{ includeUserName: true }`. so in this case, the resolver will not return any errors since the defaultValues are valid

The resolver first argument is basically `getValues` of the entire form, what do you mean "instead of the current values { includeUserName: true }"?

hrm...sorry if I'm missing something here
> The resolver first argument is basically getValues of the entire form, what do you mean "instead of the current values { includeUserName: true }"?

yeah that's my expectations, but i'm seeing the defaultValues passed to the resolver instead of getValues equivalent when we add a new input

if you follow the steps above, after adding the input, you'll see something like
![Screen Shot 2020-07-06 at 5 42 28 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8356554/86677371-6356be80-bfb0-11ea-83c7-b1d5ee0fbf0b.png)
where you can see that the validation resolver data is different than the getValues() data
hmmm interesting... will take a deeper look on this issue.
`getValues()` shouldn't be used like in your `codesandbox`, because getValues works after render, HookForm's form data lives in the input itself, which means after render.
This will be patched under V6: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-validationresolver-r2dzq?file=/src/src/useForm.ts

issue.title: improve watch API with useFieldArray delete

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
React Hook Form's form states live inside each input, which leads to difficultly to track `useFieldArray` inputs value during deletion, so this PR is aimed to improve this behavior. After this PR, user `fields` as `watch`'s defaultValue to assure `watch` return correct inputs value.

**usage:** 

```
const { fields } = useFieldArray()
watch('test', fields);
```

- remove additional function
- using `getValues()` in `useFieldArray` and `useForm` with `resolver`
- update unit tests

close #2031
close #2052
